While Real Madrid and Barcelona dominate, other clubs have had their moments. Atletico Madrid's 11 titles include recent successes in 2013-14 and 2020-21. Athletic Bilbao was a force in the early years with 8 titles, while Valencia enjoyed success in the early 2000s.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Who has won La Liga the most times?

Real Madrid has won La Liga the most times (36), followed by Barcelona (28). This makes these two clubs by far the most successful in Spanish football history.

### Who won La Liga in 2024-25?

Barcelona won La Liga in the 2024-25 season, securing their 28th title. This was their first title since 2022-23 and marked their return to the summit of Spanish football.

results.title: Barcelona win La Liga title with derby victory over Espanyol
results.content:
Advertisement

The title triumph completes a domestic clean sweep of trophies for Barca this season, having also won the Supercopa de Espana trophy in January and the Copa del Rey last month.

Barca regain the title following Madrid‚Äôs success in the 2023-24 campaign, with this season just the second title for the Catalan club since 2019.

Flick‚Äôs side made a flying start to the league with 11 wins from their opening 12 rounds of matches, but a run of one victory in just eight matches ‚Äî including four defeats ‚Äî between early November and late January saw them drop to third in the standings.

However, they have subsequently picked up 46 points from their next 16 league matches, including a 4-3 Clasico victory over Madrid on Sunday. [...] The Athletic

# Barcelona win La Liga title with derby victory over Espanyol

Pol Ball√∫s
Pol Ball√∫s

Colin Millar
Colin Millar

Barcelona have won La Liga after beating Espanyol in Thursday‚Äôs Catalan derby.

The victory moves Barca an insurmountable seven points clear of second-place Real Madrid with just two rounds of matches remaining and clinches a league title in his debut season at the club for head coach Hansi Flick.

Barca were minutes away from securing the title on Wednesday, only for Madrid to score a stoppage time winner against Mallorca at the Bernabeu. It meant victory over Espanyol would confirm Barca as champions, and they were 2-0 winners at the RCDE Stadium thanks to Lamine Yamal‚Äôs 53rd-minute goal and a late Fermin Lopez finish.

Advertisement [...] It is also a celebration of the Lamine Yamal generation. The 17-year-old gets his first league title (I‚Äôm not sure we should count that one 10-minute cameo he made in 2023, last year Barca won La Liga), and he does it as arguably the most influential footballer in the league. He will lead Barcelona‚Äôs project, with his generation team-mate Pau Cubarsi, for the foreseeable future adding up to the Pedri and Gavi generation. An excellent core to build on.

Content:
La Liga, officially known as the Primera Divisi√≥n, began in 1929 with 10 founding clubs. **FC Barcelona won the inaugural championship** , defeating Real Madrid by just two points in a thrilling first season. The competition has grown to become one of the world's most prestigious football leagues.
‚ÄúLa Liga‚Äôs history reflects Spain‚Äôs tumultuous past. Its only multi-year suspension occurred during the Civil War (1936‚Äì39), and in 2020 it was briefly halted due to the COVID-19 pandemic‚Äîmarking just two pauses across more than nine decades of competition.‚Äù

The **2024‚Äì25 La Liga** , also known as **La Liga EA Sports** [[ 1 ]]() [[ 2 ]]() due to sponsorship reasons, was the 94th season of [La Liga](/wiki/La_Liga "La Liga") , Spain's premier football competition. It commenced on 15 August 2024 and concluded on 25 May 2025. [Real Madrid](/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF "Real Madrid CF") were the defending champions, having won their 36th title the previous season. The fixture schedule was announced on 18 June 2024. [[ 3 ]]()
On 15 May 2025, [Barcelona](/wiki/FC_Barcelona "FC Barcelona") officially secured their 28th title with two matches to spare following a 2‚Äì0 win against [city rivals](/wiki/Derbi_Barcelon%C3%AD "Derbi Barcelon√≠") [Espanyol](/wiki/RCD_Espanyol "RCD Espanyol") . [[ 4 ]]()

La Liga, officially known as the Primera Divisi√≥n, began in 1929 with 10 founding clubs. **FC Barcelona won the inaugural championship** , defeating Real Madrid by just two points in a thrilling first season. The competition has grown to become one of the world's most prestigious football leagues.

The league is contested on a round-robin basis, with the title awarded to the team that finishes top at the end of the season. First established in 1929 with ten teams, La Liga has featured 20 teams since 1997.

Barcelona is also one of only two European clubs‚Äîalongside Bayern Munich, who joined them in 2020‚Äîto have won the treble twice, most recently in 2015. The current champions are Barcelona, who claimed their 28th title in the 2024‚Äì25 season. The three lowest-placed teams in La Liga are relegated to the Segunda Divisi√≥n and replaced by the top three from that division.

snippets: Real Madrid won the latest edition‚Äôs title in 2023-24. Real Madrid used to be known as Madrid FC from 1931 to 1941. Atletico Madrid‚Äôs name between the 1939-47 period was Atl√©tico Aviaci√≥n. Undoubtedly, Real Madrid has been the most successful side in Spanish league football history. Los Blancos have taken the trophy home on 36 occasions to date. Meanwhile, their arch-rival FC Barcelona tasted glory 27 times. La Liga has mostly been a race of 2 irresistible forces.

Who is the most successful team in La Liga? GoalTheBall answers and lists out all the La Liga Winners By Year. 9 different clubs had the privilege to clinch the Spanish highest division league title. FC Barcelona won the inaugural campaign in 1929. Atletico won the 1995-96 campaign when the modern ‚Äú3 points for a win‚Äù system was introduced. For the first time in history, Real Madrid claimed 100 points in the 2011-12 season.

Valencia has 6 La Liga titles and Real Sociedad won twice. Deportivo La Coru√±a, Sevilla, as well as Real Betis; each won 1 title. Since the start of the 21st century, only 5 different clubs have won the league. La Coruna grabbed their solitary title while each of Atletico and Valencia prevailed twice since 2000. Barca has been the century‚Äôs most successful Spanish side in domestic football with as many as 11 titles in this era.

snippets: Real Madrid are the most successful team in the history of LaLiga with 36 titles compared to Barcelona‚Äôs 28. Los Blancos claimed their most recent success in the 2023/24 season when Carlo Ancelotti‚Äôs side cruised to league glory with 95 points and only one defeat.

They won the league again during the pandemic-impacted 2020/21 season which was played out behind closed doors. That remains the last time a club other than Real Madrid or Barcelona won LaLiga, although unfancied Girona gave it a really good crack during the 2023/24 campaign, finishing in a surprise 3rd place.

The 1930/31 season for instance ended with the top three teams all level on points, but Athletic Club ultimately pipped Racing Santander and Real Sociedad to the title courtesy of a superior H2H goal difference in a season dominated by teams in the north of Spain. The title has never left the Spanish mainland, but Canary Islanders Las Palmas did claim a fantastic 2nd place in the late 1960s, although they never seriously threatened to knock Real Madrid off top spot.

Athletic Club by comparison have an incredible conversion rate of having also won the Copa del Rey in five of the eight seasons that they‚Äôve won the league, including their most recent league triumph in 1983/84. Atletico Madrid meanwhile have only won the double once, with their 1995/96 ‚Äòdoblete‚Äô campaign still standing alone as their finest ever season in terms of silverware, although 2013/14 ran it very close! ... Barcelona are the only Spanish team to have completed the treble.

snippets: After securing a long-awaited move to Real Madrid, Kylian Mbappe won the 2024/25 Pichichi award by scoring six goals more than anyone else across the season. While Mbappe's debut campaign in the Spanish capital was triumphant in this manner, he still garnered significant criticism that his presence hampered the team collectively despite the individual success. Real Madrid finished trophy-less while Mbappe's teammates struggled to adapt to his presence, leaving the individual award with a bitter aftertaste. Artem Dovbyk won the Pichichi prize as the top goalscorer in La Liga for 2023/24.

Kylian Mbappe may have finished the 2024/25 season without a collective trophy at Real Madrid, but his first season in white can be considered an individual success as he ran away with the La Liga top goal scorer award.

This was to mark the first La Liga match ever to be played outside of Spain. web.description: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi lead the way for Champions League goals, with Robert Lewandowski now clear in third having brought up his own century. Ronaldo has netted for Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus, with Messi on target for Barcelona and Paris Saint-Germain.
snippets: Real Madrid contested just seven games as they won the inaugural edition, compared to 13 en route to their Champions League victory in 2023/24. The all-time European Cup top Ôªøscorer, Alfredo Di St√©fano, struck 49 goals in just 58 appearances in the competition, a goals-per-game rate that none of the modern greats can match. Cristiano Ronaldo is the top scorer of all time in the Champions League and UEFA club competition as well as the most prolific in the history of senior international football.

The Polish forward was unable to retain his title the following season, Dortmund's Haaland finishing top of the 2020/21 rankings with ten goals, two more than second-ranked Kylian Mbapp√©, with the two forwards widely predicted to have the same kind of striking competition at the highest level of European football that Ronaldo and Messi enjoyed for more than a decade. That prediction has seemingly played out with Haaland topping the charts again in 2022/23 and Mbapp√© sharing the honour the following year. 2024/25: Raphinha (Barcelona), Serhou Guirassy (Dortmund) ‚Äì 13 2023/24: Harry Kane (Ba

The Argentinian joined Barcelona in early 2001 when he was just 13, and stuck with the team for the next 20 years, winning the Champions League four times in addition to ten La Liga titles, seven editions of the Copa del Rey and three UEFA Super Cups. He was the second player to reach 100 Champions League goals (after Ronaldo) and has been top scorer (or joint-top scorer) in six Champions League seasons, one fewer than Ronaldo has managed.

Real Madrid won the opening five editions, their Argentinian-born forward Alfredo Di St√©fano racking up 49 goals, a tally that no one was able to match in the 37 seasons before the competition was reinvented as the Champions League. The player who initially came closest to taking Di St√©fano's record was Portuguese phenomenon Eus√©bio, the talented striker scoring 47 goals as his Benfica side replaced Madrid as the pre-eminent force in world club football for a time.

snippets: Divisi√≥n Mayor del F√∫tbol Profesional Colombiano, better known as DIMAYOR, organizes the competition and operates the league system of promotion and relegation for both Liga DIMAYOR and Torneo DIMAYOR leagues. Since its foundation in 1948, sixteen teams have been crowned as Colombian football champions. The most successful club is Atl√©tico Nacional with 18 titles. The league was ranked as the 11th strongest national league in the world at the end of 2023 by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics.
The current format of Colombian football was adopted for the 2019 season. The top flight features 20 teams, all of which play through the Apertura and Finalizaci√≥n tournaments each year.
Source for champions and runners-up by season: RSSSF ¬∑ Teams in bold compete in the Liga DIMAYOR as of the 2025 season.

The first stage is conducted on a single round-robin basis, with each team playing the other teams once for a total of 19 matches, although an extra round of regional derbies has been included in most seasons. The top eight teams then advance to a semi-final round consisting of two groups of four teams, each team playing the others in their group twice in a double round-robin format. The two group winners advance to the final, which is played in a home-and-away double-legged fashion. Relegation to the Torneo DIMAYOR is determined by averaging the point totals achieved by teams in the first stage of the competition over the previous three seasons.

Independiente Medell√≠n, founded on 15 April 1913, is the oldest club that remains as a professional club. The first tournament was organised by the Colombian Football Federation and DIMAYOR in 1948. Ten teams signed up for this first tournament, paying the required fee of 1,000 pesos).

It commenced on 11 August 2023 and ended on 26 May 2024. Barcelona were the defending champions, having won their 27th title the previous season.

On 4 May 2024, Real Madrid were officially confirmed as champions with four matches to spare following Barcelona's 4‚Äì2 defeat to Girona, securing a record-extending 36th title.

‚Ä¶

results.title: 2023‚Äì24 La Liga - Wikipedia

results.snippet:
Since its inception, 62 teams have competed in La Liga, with nine teams crowned champions. Real Madrid and Barcelona have dominated the competition, winning 36 and 28 titles respectively. In the 1940s, Valencia, Atl√©tico Madrid, and Barcelona emerged as the strongest clubs. Real Madrid and Barcelona led the charge in the 1950s, each winning four titles.

‚Ä¶

Arenas, Barcelona, Real Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Real Sociedad and Real Uni√≥n were all selected as previous winners of the Copa del Rey. Atl√©tico Madrid, Espanyol and Europa qualified as Copa del Rey runners-up and Racing de Santander qualified through a knockout competition. Only three of the founding clubs (Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Athletic Bilbao) have never been relegated from the *Primera Divisi√≥n*.

‚Ä¶

four Copa trophies), and they also achieved the biggest win in La Liga history by beating Barcelona 12‚Äì1; This team, coached by Fred Pentland, is known by the nickname *First historic squad*, notably forming an attacking partnership with Bata, Guillermo Gorostiza, Jos√© Iraragorri, Chirri II and Lafuente. In 1935, Real Betis, then known as *Betis Balompi√©*, won their only title to date. *Primera Divisi√≥n* was suspended during the Spanish Civil War.

‚Ä¶

|Season|ATM|BAR|ATH|SEV|VAL|
|--|--|--|--|--|--|
|1939‚Äì40|**1**|9|3|2|8|
|1940‚Äì41|**1**|4|2|5|3|
|1941‚Äì42|3|12|7|6|**1**|

‚Ä¶

Meanwhile, on the other side of Spain, Barcelona began to emerge as a force under the legendary Josep Samitier. A Spanish footballer for both Barcelona and Real Madrid, Samitier cemented his legacy with Barcelona. During his playing career with Barcelona he scored 133 goals, won the inaugural La Liga title and five Copa Del Rey.

‚Ä¶

Atl√©tico Madrid were crowned La Liga champions four times in 1966, 1970, 1973, and 1977. Atl√©tico Madrid also finished second place in 1961, 1963, and 1965. In 1971, Valencia won their fourth La Liga title in 1971 under Alfredo Di St√©fano, and the Johan Cruyff-inspired Barcelona won their ninth La Liga in 1974.

‚Ä¶

For its part, Barcelona won their tenth La Liga title in 1985 under coach Terry Venables, their first La Liga win since 1974.

‚Ä¶

All in all, Barcelona won six La Liga titles in the 1990s.

### 2000s: Real Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia's re-emergence

**Results of Bar√ßa and Real Madrid in the 21st century**

‚Ä¶

The 21st century continued the success Barcelona had in the 1990s under Johan Cruyff, dominating La Liga. Although Real Madrid had been prominent, Barcelona created a hegemony in Spain not seen since the Real Madrid of the 1960s‚Äì70s. Since the start of the new century, Barcelona won ten La Ligas, including two trebles and four doubles.
This new century however has also seen new challengers being crowned champions. Between 1999‚Äì2000 and 2004, Deportivo La Coru√±a finished in the top three on five occasions, a better record than either Real Madrid or Barcelona, and in 2000, under Javier Irureta, Deportivo became the ninth team to be crowned champions.

‚Ä¶

### 2010s: Barcelona, Real Madrid and Atl√©tico

In 2009‚Äì10, Real Madrid achieved a record 96 points but still finished behind Barcelona, who amassed 99 points. Barcelona then won a third straight La Liga title in the 2010‚Äì11 season with 96 points to Real's 92, but Real Madrid ended their winning streak in the 2011‚Äì12 season under the management of Jos√© Mourinho and with the likes of Cristiano Ronaldo, √Ångel Di Mar√≠a, Mesut √ñzil and Karim Benzema.
Madrid won their 32nd La Liga title with a record 100 points, a record 121 goals scored and a record +89 goal difference. The following year, in the 2012‚Äì13 season, Barcelona won yet another La Liga title under coach Tito Vilanova, replicating the 100 points record Real Madrid achieved the previous year.
Atl√©tico Madrid, under the management of Diego Simeone, won their tenth La Liga title in 2013‚Äì14, their first since 1996. They became the first team since Valencia in 2004 to win La Liga and break Barcelona and Real Madrid's dominion over the league. In the 2014‚Äì15 season, under the trio of Messi, Neymar, and Suarez nicknamed 'MSN', Barcelona made history by becoming the first team to achieve a second Treble, and winning a sixth Liga/Copa Del Rey double.
Barcelona continued their dominance, and in the 2015‚Äì16 season they won a back-to-back Liga/Copa Del Rey double, something that had not been achieved since the 1950s. Real Madrid brought back the La Liga title under the management of Zinedine Zidane in 2016‚Äì17, but Barcelona won the title again in the 2017‚Äì18 season, as well as winning their eighth double, for seven La Liga titles in ten years.
Barcelona retained the title yet again and won their 26th La Liga title in the 2018‚Äì19 season, for eight La Liga titles in eleven years. Real Madrid reclaimed the title in 2019‚Äì20, winning the season that was severely disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic.

‚Ä¶

**Promotion and Relegation (pre-season)**

A total of twenty teams contest the league, including seventeen sides from the 2022‚Äì23 season and three promoted from the 2022‚Äì23 Segunda Divisi√≥n. This includes the two top teams from the Segunda Divisi√≥n, and the winners of the promotion play-offs.
**Teams relegated to Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first team to be relegated from La Liga were Elche, after a 2‚Äì1 loss to Almer√≠a on 2 May 2023, ending their three-year stay in the top tier. The second team to be relegated was Espanyol, after a 2‚Äì2 draw against Valencia on 28 May 2023, ending their two-year stay in top tier. The third and final team relegated to Segunda was Valladolid, after a 0‚Äì0 draw against Getafe on 4 June 2023, ending their one year stay in top tier.
**Teams promoted from Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first two teams to earn promotion from Segunda Divisi√≥n were Granada and Las Palmas, who were first and second respectively. Granada returned to La Liga after a one-year absence, while Las Palmas came back after a five-year absence. The third and final team to be promoted were Alav√©s, after winning the play-off final against Levante on 17 June 2023, returning after a on–µ-year absence.

# Spanish La Liga Winners List

## Quick Answer

Barcelona won the 2024-25 La Liga title, their 28th championship. Real Madrid leads all-time with 36 titles.

- Most Recent Winner: Barcelona (2024-25)

- Most Successful Club: Real Madrid (36 titles)

- Total Seasons Played: 94 (excluding 1936-39)

## Table of Contents

## La Liga Champions by Year (1929-2025)

## Recent La Liga Winners (Last 10 Years)

## La Liga Recent Champions

The last decade has seen intense competition between Spain's biggest clubs

#### ü•á 2024-25 CHAMPION

**FC Barcelona**

28th Title

Manager: Hansi Flick

*Reclaimed the crown from Real Madrid*

#### ü•à 2023-24 CHAMPION

**Real Madrid**

36th Title

Manager: Carlo Ancelotti

*Record-extending championship*

## La Liga Winners Statistics

#### Top 5 Most Successful Clubs

Real Madrid, Barcelona, Atl√©tico Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, and Valencia have dominated the Spanish league more than any other clubs in La Liga.

#### Athletico Bilbao - Early Days

Athletic Bilbao won the La Liga in 1930, 1931, 1934, and 1936. They may have slummed in recent times, but they were once a force to reckon with.

## La Liga History and Development

La Liga, officially known as the Primera Divisi√≥n, began in 1929 with 10 founding clubs.

**FC Barcelona won the inaugural championship**, defeating Real Madrid by just two points in a thrilling first season. The competition has grown to become one of the world's most prestigious football leagues.

‚ÄúLa Liga‚Äôs history reflects Spain‚Äôs tumultuous past. Its only multi-year suspension occurred during the Civil War (1936‚Äì39), and in 2020 it was briefly halted due to the COVID-19 pandemic‚Äîmarking just two pauses across more than nine decades of competition.‚Äù‚Äî English Wikipedia, ‚ÄúLa Liga‚Äù and ‚Äú1939‚Äì40 La Liga‚Äù entries

### Historical Milestones At A Glance

**Founded:** 1929 | **First Champion:** FC Barcelona | **Most Titles:** Real Madrid (36)

**Total Seasons:** 94 | **Civil War Break:** 1936-39 | **Different Winners:** 9 clubs

The competition format has undergone significant evolution since its inception. Initially featuring just 10 teams, La Liga expanded to 16 teams in 1934, then to 18 teams in 1971, and finally to the

**current 20-team format in 1997**. This expansion has allowed more clubs to compete at the highest level of Spanish football.

## Real Madrid vs Barcelona Dominance

The rivalry between Real Madrid and Barcelona, known as "El Cl√°sico," has defined La Liga for decades. Together,

**these two giants have won 64 of the 94 championships**, representing an extraordinary 68% dominance of Spanish football.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Who has won La Liga the most times?

Real Madrid has won La Liga the most times (36), followed by Barcelona (28). This makes these two clubs by far the most successful in Spanish football history.

### Who won La Liga in 2024-25?

Barcelona won La Liga in the 2024-25 season, securing their 28th title. This was their first title since 2022-23 and marked their return to the summit of Spanish football.

results.snippet:
News

THU 15.05.2025

**FC Barcelona are the new champions of LALIGA EA SPORTS.** Hansi Flick‚Äôs team defeated RCD Espanyol 0-2 at the RCDE Stadium with a stunning goal from a stellar **Lamine Yamal** and another from **Ferm√≠n**, sealing the league title. The Catalan side now leads Real Madrid by **seven points**, with only six left to play for.
FC Barcelona have been the most consistent team in LALIGA EA SPORTS 2024/25. Although they trailed the leaders by several points during certain phases of the campaign, an almost perfect second half of the season allowed them to clinch the title

**with two rounds to spare**.

Crucial to this achievement were the two victories over second-place
**Real Madrid**. FC Barcelona delivered a stunning **0-4 win at the Santiago Bernab√©u** in the first half of the season and last week triumphed in a thrilling **ELCL√ÅSICO** with a **4-3 win**, effectively sealing the title.
**Lamine Yamal and Raphinha** were decisive in both Cl√°sicos and have been key contributors all season long. The Spaniard and the Brazilian shone on the wings and were arguably the spearhead of a vertical, direct, and lethal team.
Also contributing were **Ferran Torres and Robert Lewandowski**, the latter being the team‚Äôs **top scorer with 25 goals**; **Pedri**, who served as the team‚Äôs midfield compass; and a solid defense featuring standout performances from **centre-back duo Pau Cubars√≠ and I√±igo Mart√≠nez**, along with **Jules Kound√©** on the right flank.
This is

**FC Barcelona‚Äôs 28th LALIGA EA SPORTS title**, putting them second in the all-time list, just behind Real Madrid.

¬© LALIGA - 2025

## Teams

### Promotion and relegation (pre-season)

A total of twenty teams contest the league, including seventeen sides from the 2023‚Äì24 season and three promoted from the 2023‚Äì24 Segunda Divisi√≥n. This includes the two top teams from the Segunda Divisi√≥n, and the winners of the promotion play-offs.

- **Teams relegated to Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first team to be relegated from La Liga were Almer√≠a, after a 1‚Äì3 loss to Getafe on 27 April 2024, ending their two-year stay in top tier. The second team to be relegated was Granada, following Mallorca‚Äôs 1‚Äì0 win against Las Palmas, suffering immediate relegation. The third and final team relegated to Segunda was C√°diz, after a 0‚Äì0 draw against Las Palmas on 19 May 2024, ending their four-year stay in the top tier.

- **Teams promoted from Segunda Divisi√≥n**

On 26 May 2024, Valladolid became the first side to mathematically be automatically promoted, assured of a return to the top flight following a 3‚Äì2 win against Villarreal B, thus returning after a single season absence. The second and final team to earn automatic promotion was Legan√©s, following a 2‚Äì0 win against Elche on 2 June 2024, thus returning after a four-season absence and also being promoted to the top flight for the second time in their history. The third and final team to be promoted was Espanyol, following their win against Oviedo in the promotion play-off final, returning to the top flight after only a single season.

# La Liga 2023-24: Decoding the season in stats

__Rajdeep Saha__

What's the story

The La Liga 2023-24 season ended on Sunday. Champions Real Madrid finished their campaign with two draws. Barcelona, who saw manager Xavi Hernandez get sacked, finished second. They ended the season with four successive wins under the Spaniard. Team of the Season, Girona, took third place with Atletico Madrid taking up fourth place. Cadiz, Almeria and Granada were relegated. Here are the stats.

Real Madrid

### Real topped the show

Real Madrid ended their 2023-24 La Liga season with a 0-0 draw against Real Betis. Los Blancos had already sealed the trophy on matchday 34. Real claimed 29 wins, eight draws and one defeat. Carlo Ancelotti's men finished with 95 points from 38 matches. Real Madrid ended the La Liga 2023-24 season with 21 clean sheets.

Champions League

### Barcelona, Girona and Atletico earn Champions League football

FC Barcelona finished second with 26 wins, seven draws and five defeats. They collected 85 points and had a goal difference of +35. Girona claimed 25 wins, six draws and seven defeats. They managed 81 points (GD +39). Diego Simeone's Atletico Madrid earned the final Champions League spot. Atletico earned 24 wins (D4 L10) and finished with 76 points.

Information

### These three clubs will play in Europe

Athletic Club finished fifth and will play in the UEFA Europa League. Athletic Club finished with 68 points. Real Sociedad will also ply their trade in Europa League (60 points). Seventh-placed Real Betis will feature in the Conference League qualifiers (57 points).

Relegation

### Stats of the relegated teams

Granada finished 20th, collecting 21 points. 19th-placed Almeria also collected 21 points but had a better goal difference. Meanwhile, Cadiz finished 18th with 33 points. Granada posted the second-fewest wins (4) and conceded the most goals (79). They also suffered the most defeats (25). Almeria managed the fewest wins (3). They conceded the second-most goals (75). Cadiz had a goal difference of -29 (3rd-worst).

Numbers

### Team and individual stats

**Most goals:** Real Madrid (87)

**Second-most goals:** Girona (85)

**Fewest goals conceded:** Real Madrid (26)

**Most draws:** Mallorca (15)

**Best goal difference:** Real Madrid (+61)

**Highest individual goal-scorer:** Artem Dovbyk (24, Girona)
**Highest individual assists:** √Ålex Baena (14, Villarreal)

**Player involved in most goals:** Artem Dovbyk (32, Girona)

**Most big chances created:** Iago Ispas (21, Celta Vigo) and Miguel Guti√©rrez (21, Girona)

Information

### Unique record for the top four La Liga teams

As per

*Opta*, four of the six teams in Europe's top five leagues with the most home wins were from La Liga , with Real and Atletico at the top with 16 wins each. Barca, Girona, Liverpool and Arsenal had 15 wins each.

Opta stats

### Here are the unique records

A total of 1,005 goals were scored in La Liga 2023-24. This is the highest goals scored in the competition without Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo taking part since 2003-04 (1,015). Girona (20) clocked the most goals after sequences of 10 or more passes in La Liga 2023-24. Real were the La Liga team with the highest time in play (59:43).

Kroos

### Toni Kroos signs off

Toni Kroos played his last game of his La Liga career. He is the second German with the most appearances in the competition (306), behind only Bernd Schuster (316).

As per

*Squawka*, Kroos completed every La Liga campaign of his career with at least 92% pass accuracy.

Kroos scored 22 goals and made 70 assists in La Liga. He won four titles.

Bellingham

### Bellingham voted La Liga Player of the Season

Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham was voted La Liga Player of the Season. The English midfielder joined Real from Borussia Dortmund last summer in a massive deal. Bellingham featured in 28 La Liga matches. He scored 19 goals which was the joint-third most alongside FC Barcelona's Robert Lewandowski. Bellingham made six assists and was involved in 25 goals (highest for Real).

Information

### Here are the other award winners

48-year-old M√≠chel (Girona FC) won the award for Best Coach. Yamine Lamal (FC Barcelona) received the distinction of Best U23 Player. Jes√∫s Areso (Osasuna) won the Best Goal of the Season for his strike against Getafe CF.

It commenced on 11 August 2023 and ended on 26 May 2024. Barcelona were the defending champions, having won their 27th title the previous season.

On 4 May 2024, Real Madrid were officially confirmed as champions with four matches to spare following Barcelona's 4‚Äì2 defeat to Girona, securing a record-extending 36th title.

results.snippet:
Since its inception, 62 teams have competed in La Liga, with nine teams crowned champions. Real Madrid and Barcelona have dominated the competition, winning 36 and 28 titles respectively. In the 1940s, Valencia, Atl√©tico Madrid, and Barcelona emerged as the strongest clubs. Real Madrid and Barcelona led the charge in the 1950s, each winning four titles.

‚Ä¶

Arenas, Barcelona, Real Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Real Sociedad and Real Uni√≥n were all selected as previous winners of the Copa del Rey. Atl√©tico Madrid, Espanyol and Europa qualified as Copa del Rey runners-up and Racing de Santander qualified through a knockout competition. Only three of the founding clubs (Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Athletic Bilbao) have never been relegated from the *Primera Divisi√≥n*.

‚Ä¶

four Copa trophies), and they also achieved the biggest win in La Liga history by beating Barcelona 12‚Äì1; This team, coached by Fred Pentland, is known by the nickname *First historic squad*, notably forming an attacking partnership with Bata, Guillermo Gorostiza, Jos√© Iraragorri, Chirri II and Lafuente. In 1935, Real Betis, then known as *Betis Balompi√©*, won their only title to date. *Primera Divisi√≥n* was suspended during the Spanish Civil War.

‚Ä¶

|Season|ATM|BAR|ATH|SEV|VAL|
|--|--|--|--|--|--|
|1939‚Äì40|**1**|9|3|2|8|
|1940‚Äì41|**1**|4|2|5|3|
|1941‚Äì42|3|12|7|6|**1**|

‚Ä¶

Meanwhile, on the other side of Spain, Barcelona began to emerge as a force under the legendary Josep Samitier. A Spanish footballer for both Barcelona and Real Madrid, Samitier cemented his legacy with Barcelona. During his playing career with Barcelona he scored 133 goals, won the inaugural La Liga title and five Copa Del Rey.

‚Ä¶

Atl√©tico Madrid were crowned La Liga champions four times in 1966, 1970, 1973, and 1977. Atl√©tico Madrid also finished second place in 1961, 1963, and 1965. In 1971, Valencia won their fourth La Liga title in 1971 under Alfredo Di St√©fano, and the Johan Cruyff-inspired Barcelona won their ninth La Liga in 1974.

‚Ä¶

For its part, Barcelona won their tenth La Liga title in 1985 under coach Terry Venables, their first La Liga win since 1974.

‚Ä¶

All in all, Barcelona won six La Liga titles in the 1990s.

The 21st century continued the success Barcelona had in the 1990s under Johan Cruyff, dominating La Liga. Although Real Madrid had been prominent, Barcelona created a hegemony in Spain not seen since the Real Madrid of the 1960s‚Äì70s. Since the start of the new century, Barcelona won ten La Ligas, including two trebles and four doubles.
This new century however has also seen new challengers being crowned champions. Between 1999‚Äì2000 and 2004, Deportivo La Coru√±a finished in the top three on five occasions, a better record than either Real Madrid or Barcelona, and in 2000, under Javier Irureta, Deportivo became the ninth team to be crowned champions.

‚Ä¶

### 2010s: Barcelona, Real Madrid and Atl√©tico

In 2009‚Äì10, Real Madrid achieved a record 96 points but still finished behind Barcelona, who amassed 99 points. Barcelona then won a third straight La Liga title in the 2010‚Äì11 season with 96 points to Real's 92, but Real Madrid ended their winning streak in the 2011‚Äì12 season under the management of Jos√© Mourinho and with the likes of Cristiano Ronaldo, √Ångel Di Mar√≠a, Mesut √ñzil and Karim Benzema.
Madrid won their 32nd La Liga title with a record 100 points, a record 121 goals scored and a record +89 goal difference. The following year, in the 2012‚Äì13 season, Barcelona won yet another La Liga title under coach Tito Vilanova, replicating the 100 points record Real Madrid achieved the previous year.
Atl√©tico Madrid, under the management of Diego Simeone, won their tenth La Liga title in 2013‚Äì14, their first since 1996. They became the first team since Valencia in 2004 to win La Liga and break Barcelona and Real Madrid's dominion over the league. In the 2014‚Äì15 season, under the trio of Messi, Neymar, and Suarez nicknamed 'MSN', Barcelona made history by becoming the first team to achieve a second Treble, and winning a sixth Liga/Copa Del Rey double.
Barcelona continued their dominance, and in the 2015‚Äì16 season they won a back-to-back Liga/Copa Del Rey double, something that had not been achieved since the 1950s. Real Madrid brought back the La Liga title under the management of Zinedine Zidane in 2016‚Äì17, but Barcelona won the title again in the 2017‚Äì18 season, as well as winning their eighth double, for seven La Liga titles in ten years.
Barcelona retained the title yet again and won their 26th La Liga title in the 2018‚Äì19 season, for eight La Liga titles in eleven years. Real Madrid reclaimed the title in 2019‚Äì20, winning the season that was severely disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic.

‚Ä¶

**Promotion and Relegation (pre-season)**

A total of twenty teams contest the league, including seventeen sides from the 2022‚Äì23 season and three promoted from the 2022‚Äì23 Segunda Divisi√≥n. This includes the two top teams from the Segunda Divisi√≥n, and the winners of the promotion play-offs.
**Teams relegated to Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first team to be relegated from La Liga were Elche, after a 2‚Äì1 loss to Almer√≠a on 2 May 2023, ending their three-year stay in the top tier. The second team to be relegated was Espanyol, after a 2‚Äì2 draw against Valencia on 28 May 2023, ending their two-year stay in top tier. The third and final team relegated to Segunda was Valladolid, after a 0‚Äì0 draw against Getafe on 4 June 2023, ending their one year stay in top tier.
**Teams promoted from Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first two teams to earn promotion from Segunda Divisi√≥n were Granada and Las Palmas, who were first and second respectively. Granada returned to La Liga after a one-year absence, while Las Palmas came back after a five-year absence. The third and final team to be promoted were Alav√©s, after winning the play-off final against Levante on 17 June 2023, returning after a on–µ-year absence.

# Spanish La Liga Winners List

## Quick Answer

Barcelona won the 2024-25 La Liga title, their 28th championship. Real Madrid leads all-time with 36 titles.

- Most Recent Winner: Barcelona (2024-25)

- Most Successful Club: Real Madrid (36 titles)

- Total Seasons Played: 94 (excluding 1936-39)

## Table of Contents

## La Liga Champions by Year (1929-2025)

The complete list of Spanish La Liga Primera Divisi√≥n winners shows the

## Recent La Liga Winners (Last 10 Years)

## La Liga Recent Champions

The last decade has seen intense competition between Spain's biggest clubs

#### ü•á 2024-25 CHAMPION

**FC Barcelona**

28th Title

Manager: Hansi Flick

*Reclaimed the crown from Real Madrid*

#### ü•à 2023-24 CHAMPION

**Real Madrid**

36th Title

Manager: Carlo Ancelotti

*Record-extending championship*

## La Liga Winners Statistics

#### Top 5 Most Successful Clubs

Real Madrid, Barcelona, Atl√©tico Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, and Valencia have dominated the Spanish league more than any other clubs in La Liga.

#### Athletico Bilbao - Early Days

Athletic Bilbao won the La Liga in 1930, 1931, 1934, and 1936. They may have slummed in recent times, but they were once a force to reckon with.

## La Liga History and Development

La Liga, officially known as the Primera Divisi√≥n, began in 1929 with 10 founding clubs.

**FC Barcelona won the inaugural championship**, defeating Real Madrid by just two points in a thrilling first season. The competition has grown to become one of the world's most prestigious football leagues.

‚ÄúLa Liga‚Äôs history reflects Spain‚Äôs tumultuous past. Its only multi-year suspension occurred during the Civil War (1936‚Äì39), and in 2020 it was briefly halted due to the COVID-19 pandemic‚Äîmarking just two pauses across more than nine decades of competition.‚Äù‚Äî English Wikipedia, ‚ÄúLa Liga‚Äù and ‚Äú1939‚Äì40 La Liga‚Äù entries

### Historical Milestones At A Glance

**Founded:** 1929 | **First Champion:** FC Barcelona | **Most Titles:** Real Madrid (36)

**Total Seasons:** 94 | **Civil War Break:** 1936-39 | **Different Winners:** 9 clubs

The competition format has undergone significant evolution since its inception. Initially featuring just 10 teams, La Liga expanded to 16 teams in 1934, then to 18 teams in 1971, and finally to the

**current 20-team format in 1997**. This expansion has allowed more clubs to compete at the highest level of Spanish football.

## Real Madrid vs Barcelona Dominance

The rivalry between Real Madrid and Barcelona, known as "El Cl√°sico," has defined La Liga for decades. Together,

**these two giants have won 64 of the 94 championships**, representing an extraordinary 68% dominance of Spanish football.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Who has won La Liga the most times?

Real Madrid has won La Liga the most times (36), followed by Barcelona (28). This makes these two clubs by far the most successful in Spanish football history.

### Who won La Liga in 2024-25?

Barcelona won La Liga in the 2024-25 season, securing their 28th title. This was their first title since 2022-23 and marked their return to the summit of Spanish football.

The current champions are Barcelona, who claimed their 28th title in the 2024‚Äì25 season.

News

THU 15.05.2025

**FC Barcelona are the new champions of LALIGA EA SPORTS.** Hansi Flick‚Äôs team defeated RCD Espanyol 0-2 at the RCDE Stadium with a stunning goal from a stellar **Lamine Yamal** and another from **Ferm√≠n**, sealing the league title. The Catalan side now leads Real Madrid by **seven points**, with only six left to play for.
FC Barcelona have been the most consistent team in LALIGA EA SPORTS 2024/25. Although they trailed the leaders by several points during certain phases of the campaign, an almost perfect second half of the season allowed them to clinch the title

**with two rounds to spare**.

Crucial to this achievement were the two victories over second-place
**Real Madrid**. FC Barcelona delivered a stunning **0-4 win at the Santiago Bernab√©u** in the first half of the season and last week triumphed in a thrilling **ELCL√ÅSICO** with a **4-3 win**, effectively sealing the title.
**Lamine Yamal and Raphinha** were decisive in both Cl√°sicos and have been key contributors all season long. The Spaniard and the Brazilian shone on the wings and were arguably the spearhead of a vertical, direct, and lethal team.
Also contributing were **Ferran Torres and Robert Lewandowski**, the latter being the team‚Äôs **top scorer with 25 goals**; **Pedri**, who served as the team‚Äôs midfield compass; and a solid defense featuring standout performances from **centre-back duo Pau Cubars√≠ and I√±igo Mart√≠nez**, along with **Jules Kound√©** on the right flank.
This is

**FC Barcelona‚Äôs 28th LALIGA EA SPORTS title**, putting them second in the all-time list, just behind Real Madrid.

## Teams

### Promotion and relegation (pre-season)

A total of twenty teams contest the league, including seventeen sides from the 2023‚Äì24 season and three promoted from the 2023‚Äì24 Segunda Divisi√≥n. This includes the two top teams from the Segunda Divisi√≥n, and the winners of the promotion play-offs.

- **Teams relegated to Segunda Divisi√≥n**

The first team to be relegated from La Liga were Almer√≠a, after a 1‚Äì3 loss to Getafe on 27 April 2024, ending their two-year stay in top tier. The second team to be relegated was Granada, following Mallorca‚Äôs 1‚Äì0 win against Las Palmas, suffering immediate relegation. The third and final team relegated to Segunda was C√°diz, after a 0‚Äì0 draw against Las Palmas on 19 May 2024, ending their four-year stay in the top tier.

- **Teams promoted from Segunda Divisi√≥n**

On 26 May 2024, Valladolid became the first side to mathematically be automatically promoted, assured of a return to the top flight following a 3‚Äì2 win against Villarreal B, thus returning after a single season absence. The second and final team to earn automatic promotion was Legan√©s, following a 2‚Äì0 win against Elche on 2 June 2024, thus returning after a four-season absence and also being promoted to the top flight for the second time in their history. The third and final team to be promoted was Espanyol, following their win against Oviedo in the promotion play-off final, returning to the top flight after only a single season.

results.snippet:
# La Liga 2023-24: Decoding the season in stats

__Rajdeep Saha__

What's the story

The La Liga 2023-24 season ended on Sunday. Champions Real Madrid finished their campaign with two draws. Barcelona, who saw manager Xavi Hernandez get sacked, finished second. They ended the season with four successive wins under the Spaniard. Team of the Season, Girona, took third place with Atletico Madrid taking up fourth place. Cadiz, Almeria and Granada were relegated. Here are the stats.

Real Madrid

### Real topped the show

Real Madrid ended their 2023-24 La Liga season with a 0-0 draw against Real Betis. Los Blancos had already sealed the trophy on matchday 34. Real claimed 29 wins, eight draws and one defeat. Carlo Ancelotti's men finished with 95 points from 38 matches. Real Madrid ended the La Liga 2023-24 season with 21 clean sheets.

Champions League

### Barcelona, Girona and Atletico earn Champions League football

FC Barcelona finished second with 26 wins, seven draws and five defeats. They collected 85 points and had a goal difference of +35. Girona claimed 25 wins, six draws and seven defeats. They managed 81 points (GD +39). Diego Simeone's Atletico Madrid earned the final Champions League spot. Atletico earned 24 wins (D4 L10) and finished with 76 points.

Information

### These three clubs will play in Europe

Athletic Club finished fifth and will play in the UEFA Europa League. Athletic Club finished with 68 points. Real Sociedad will also ply their trade in Europa League (60 points). Seventh-placed Real Betis will feature in the Conference League qualifiers (57 points).

Relegation

### Stats of the relegated teams

Granada finished 20th, collecting 21 points. 19th-placed Almeria also collected 21 points but had a better goal difference. Meanwhile, Cadiz finished 18th with 33 points. Granada posted the second-fewest wins (4) and conceded the most goals (79). They also suffered the most defeats (25). Almeria managed the fewest wins (3). They conceded the second-most goals (75). Cadiz had a goal difference of -29 (3rd-worst).

Numbers

### Team and individual stats

**Most goals:** Real Madrid (87)

**Second-most goals:** Girona (85)

**Fewest goals conceded:** Real Madrid (26)

**Most draws:** Mallorca (15)

**Best goal difference:** Real Madrid (+61)

**Highest individual goal-scorer:** Artem Dovbyk (24, Girona)
**Highest individual assists:** √Ålex Baena (14, Villarreal)

**Player involved in most goals:** Artem Dovbyk (32, Girona)

**Most big chances created:** Iago Ispas (21, Celta Vigo) and Miguel Guti√©rrez (21, Girona)

Information

### Unique record for the top four La Liga teams

As per

*Opta*, four of the six teams in Europe's top five leagues with the most home wins were from La Liga , with Real and Atletico at the top with 16 wins each. Barca, Girona, Liverpool and Arsenal had 15 wins each.

Opta stats

### Here are the unique records

A total of 1,005 goals were scored in La Liga 2023-24. This is the highest goals scored in the competition without Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo taking part since 2003-04 (1,015). Girona (20) clocked the most goals after sequences of 10 or more passes in La Liga 2023-24. Real were the La Liga team with the highest time in play (59:43).

Kroos

### Toni Kroos signs off

Toni Kroos played his last game of his La Liga career. He is the second German with the most appearances in the competition (306), behind only Bernd Schuster (316).

As per

*Squawka*, Kroos completed every La Liga campaign of his career with at least 92% pass accuracy.

Kroos scored 22 goals and made 70 assists in La Liga. He won four titles.

Bellingham

### Bellingham voted La Liga Player of the Season

Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham was voted La Liga Player of the Season. The English midfielder joined Real from Borussia Dortmund last summer in a massive deal. Bellingham featured in 28 La Liga matches. He scored 19 goals which was the joint-third most alongside FC Barcelona's Robert Lewandowski. Bellingham made six assists and was involved in 25 goals (highest for Real).

Information

### Here are the other award winners

48-year-old M√≠chel (Girona FC) won the award for Best Coach. Yamine Lamal (FC Barcelona) received the distinction of Best U23 Player. Jes√∫s Areso (Osasuna) won the Best Goal of the Season for his strike against Getafe CF.

results.title: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo (Feb 1, 2026) Game Analysis - ESPN
results.content: # Real Madrid v Rayo. # Mbapp√© scores last-gasp penalty as Real Madrid edge Rayo Vallecano. Kylian Mbapp√©'s penalty in the 10th minute of stoppage time secured a dramatic 2-1 victory for Real Madrid over lowly Rayo Vallecano to cut Barcelona's lead at the top of LaLiga. In what was an eventful Madrid derby, Real also lost Jude Bellingham to a suspected hamstring injury. The last-gasp victory sees Real trail Barcelona by a single point after 22 league games. A poor Ciss lunge saw Rayo reduced to 10 and Real struck the goal frame again five minutes from when Eduardo Camavinga headed Ceballos' centre onto a post. Batalla foiled Rodrygo from point-blank range deep into stoppage time, but Real blushes were spared as Mbapp√© kept his composure from 12 yards. | Real Madrid | 22 | 17 | 3 | 2 | +29 | 54 |. Jude Bellingham is likely to miss a month due to injury for Real Madrid, sources told ESPN.

results.title: Real Madrid CF - Wikipedia
results.content: a 1‚Äì2 away loss against the same opposition in La Liga three days later. The team then was knocked out of the Copa del Rey by Celta Vigo 3‚Äì4 on aggregate. These slips, however, did not affect the overall trajectory of the season. In May, Madrid won the league title for a record 33rd time, their first title in five years, accumulating 93 points in the process. On 3 June 2017, the club's victory over Juventus in the Champions League final resulted in Real Madrid becoming the first team to successfully defend their title in the UEFA Champions League era, and the first to win consecutive titles in the competition since Milan in 1989 and 1990, when the tournament was known as the European Cup. Real Madrid's title was its 12th, extending the record, and its third in four years. The achievement [...] Real Madrid started the 2012‚Äì13 season by winning the Supercopa de Espa√±a, defeating Barcelona on away goals. However, the super cup turned out to be their only trophy of the season, despite being close to win them all. Real finished runners-up to Bar√ßa in La Liga, accumulating 85 points, and reached the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League for the third year in a row, where they were eliminated by Borussia Dortmund 3‚Äì4 on aggregate. Madrid also entered the Copa del Rey in the round of 32, going on a memorable run to the final, which saw them defeat Barcelona in the semi-finals before losing to Atl√©tico Madrid 1‚Äì2 a.e.t#Association_football "Overtime (sports)"). Real Madrid faced the Blaugrana six times throughout the season, coming away with three wins, two draws, and one loss. A [...] In the 2011‚Äì12 season, Real Madrid won La Liga for a record 32nd time in its history, also finishing the season with numerous league records set, including 100 points amassed in a single season, a total of 121 goals scored, a goal difference of +89, 16 away games won, and 32 wins overall. They also competed in the UEFA Champions League for the 15th successive season, losing in the semi-finals to Bayern Munich in a penalty shoot-out "Penalty shoot-out (association football)") after a 3‚Äì3 aggregate tie. Madrid entered the Copa del Rey as the defending champions, but lost 3‚Äì4 on aggregate in the quarter-finals to Barcelona. snippets: The club first participated in European competition during the 1954‚Äì55 season, when it played in the Latin Cup. It won its first major European title, and the inaugural European Cup, during the 1955‚Äì56 season. Real Madrid won the first five editions of the European Cup, and a further ten titles, the last of which was in 2024, holding the record for the most victories in the tournament. The club won the UEFA Cup during the 1984‚Äì85 season and retained the trophy the following year. The club has won La Liga 36 times, the Copa del Rey 20 times, the Supercopa de Espa√±a 13 times, the Copa de la Liga once, the Copa Eva Duarte once, the European Cup/Champions League 15 times, the UEFA Cup twice, the European/UEFA Super Cup six times, the Intercontinental Cup three times, the FIFA Intercontinental Cup once and the FIFA Club World Cup five times.

^ Real Madrid qualified to play Real Sociedad for the Supercopa de Espa√±a but the game was not arranged. ^ Real Madrid automatically received the trophy as it won the league championship and Copa del Rey double. ^ S√°nchez was La Liga top scorer (38 goals) and won the European Golden Shoe.

^ Cristiano Ronaldo was La Liga top scorer (48 goals) and won the European Golden Shoe. ^ Real Madrid were disqualified from the competition after accidentally fielding an ineligible player in the first leg of the round of 32.

Real Madrid Club de F√∫tbol is a football club that plays in La Liga. The club was formed in 1902 as Madrid Football Club, and played its first competitive match on 13 May 1902, when it lost 3‚Äì1 in the semi-final of the Campeonato de Copa de S.M. Alfonso XIII against FC Barcelona.

Real Madrid played against other local clubs in various regional tournaments, that served as qualifiers for the Copa del Rey, from 1902 to 1940. In 1929, the club became one of the founding members of La Liga, Spain's first national league.

web.description: Ronaldo set a new club mark for ... first player ever to score against all 19 opposition teams in a single season. However, the super cup turned out to be their only trophy of the season, despite being close to win them all. Real finished runners-up to Bar√ßa in La Liga, accumulating ...
snippets: Ronaldo set a new club mark for individual goals scored in one year (60) and became the first player ever to score against all 19 opposition teams in a single season. Real Madrid started the 2012‚Äì13 season by winning the Supercopa de Espa√±a, defeating Barcelona on away goals. However, the super cup turned out to be their only trophy of the season, despite being close to win them all. Real finished runners-up to Bar√ßa in La Liga, accumulating 85 points, and reached the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League for the third year in a row, where they were eliminated by Borussia Dortmund 3‚Äì4 on aggregate.

With 121 matches (from 17 February 1957 to 7 March 1965), the club holds the record for longest unbeaten run at home in La Liga. The club also holds the record for winning the European Cup/UEFA Champions League fifteen times and for the most semi-finals appearances (33). As of June 2024, Cristiano Ronaldo is the all-time top scorer in the UEFA Champions League, with 140 (141 including qualifiers) goals in total, 105 while playing for Real Madrid.

Cristiano Ronaldo also holds the record for the most league goals scored in one season (48 in 2014‚Äì15), alongside being Real's top goalscorer of all time in La Liga history with 311 goals. Di St√©fano's 49 goals in 58 matches was for decades the all-time highest tally in the European Cup, until it was surpassed by Ra√∫l in 2005, and is now held by Cristiano Ronaldo with 105 goals for Madrid and 140 overall.

Then, Real Madrid lifted the La Liga with relative ease, reaching 95 points, the second-best winning campaign by Real Madrid in La Liga history after the 2011‚Äì12 100 points season. In the 2023‚Äì24 UEFA Champions League, Real Madrid knocked out RB Leipzig in the Round of 16, then defending champions Manchester City in penalties. In the semifinals, Real Madrid faced Bayern Munich again. The first match was a 2‚Äì2 draw, while the second match in the Bernab√©u was marked by a double by Joselu in the last few minutes of the game, with Bayern Munich suffering a historic comeback after leading 1‚Äì0.

The club competes in La Liga, the top tier of Spanish football. Founded in 1902 as Madrid Football Club, the club has traditionally worn a white home kit. The honorific title 'Real' is Spanish for "Royal" and was bestowed by Alfonso XIII in 1920. Real Madrid have played their home matches in the 78,297-capacity Santiago Bernab√©u since 1947.

## Real Madrid

##### Aug 19, 2025 (0:03:09)

Real Madrid made a winning start to their LaLiga campaign with their first three points of the season at the Bernab√©u. Xabi Alonso's men, who dominated the game from start to finish, overcame Osasuna on the opening matchday of the season. After a goalless first half, Mbapp√©, last season's Golden Boot winner, gave the Madridistas the win with a penalty goal early in the second half of the clash. Carreras, who started the game, and Mastantuono made their official debuts for the team.
